source.title: Why Vitest | Guide | Vitest
source.description: Rationale for Vitest as a Vite-native test runner: unified configuration pipeline, instant HMR, Jest-compatible API, parallel execution via Worker threads, lightweight dependencies, performance improvements, and watch mode enabled by default.

source.title: Getting Started | Guide | Vitest
source.description: Installation, basic test writing with expect API, configuration via vite.config or vitest.config, projects support, CLI usage, IDE integrations, dependency management, examples, and community resources.

source.title: Features | Guide | Vitest
source.description: Feature overview: Vite config integration, smart watch mode, component testing, concurrent execution, snapshots, mocking with Tinyspy, coverage via v8 or istanbul, in-source testing, benchmarking, type testing, and sharding.

source.title: Configuring Vitest | Vitest
source.description: Configuration reference: test property options, file patterns, server settings, execution modes, environments, reporters, coverage, mocking, benchmarking, browser mode, workspace projects, and all parameters with types and defaults.
